intro: Oncoba fissistyla, commonly known as the Caribbean palm, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is a member of the Arecaceae family, characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible fruits that are about the size of a lemon. Oncoba fissistyla is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and wind-swept environments. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in the region's flora.
